intro: Popowia rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed popowia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Popowia rufescens is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
